> **[c3]** on "last-writer-wins register"

**TomÃ¡s Rivera** â€” Mar 26, 2025 4:20 AM
LWW at field level feels too coarse for rich text. What happens when two people bold different words in the same paragraph?

**Sarah Chen** â€” Mar 26, 2025 6:45 AM
That's handled by the Peritext layer, not LWW. LWW only kicks in for scalar fields like title and metadata. Text content goes through character-level CRDT merge. I'll clarify this in section 2.3.

> **[c4]** on "storage overhead"

**James Okafor** â€” Mar 27, 2025 1:00 AM
We should add a note about compaction. After running Automerge's compaction pass, the overhead drops to ~15% for large documents. Without compaction the history grows unbounded.
